content.summary: A high-performance Next.js blog platform featuring Markdown editing, SEO tools, and a Node.js/PostgreSQL backend for scalable content management.
content.description: This project builds a robust blogging engine designed for developers and creators. It leverages Next.js for Server-Side Rendering (SSR) to ensure optimal SEO and fast load times. Key features include a Markdown-based editor, granular taxonomy (categories/tags), author profiles, and a secure Node.js API managing a PostgreSQL database, with static assets served via CDN.

user_stories.title: Markdown Post Creation
user_stories.story: As an author, I want to write posts using Markdown so that I can format code and text efficiently without complex UI.
user_stories.description: Implementation of a Markdown editor with syntax highlighting and live preview in the admin panel.
acceptance_criteria: Images can be uploaded and referenced

user_stories.title: SEO Meta Management
user_stories.story: As a site owner, I want to configure meta tags for each post so that the content ranks well on search engines.
user_stories.description: Fields for custom title, description, and canonical URLs that inject into the Next.js Head component.
acceptance_criteria: Input fields for Meta Title and Description

user_stories.title: Public Comment System
user_stories.story: As a reader, I want to leave comments on posts so that I can engage with the author and community.
user_stories.description: Nested comment system with basic moderation tools and spam protection.
acceptance_criteria: Support for nested replies (1 level deep)

user_stories.title: Full-Text Search
user_stories.story: As a visitor, I want to search for keywords so that I can find relevant articles quickly.
user_stories.description: Search API endpoint querying PostgreSQL with full-text search capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Search queries title and body content

user_stories.title: Admin Dashboard
user_stories.story: As an admin, I want a dashboard to manage content so that I can view, edit, or delete posts and users.
user_stories.description: Protected route in Next.js displaying data tables for posts, users, and analytics summaries.
acceptance_criteria: List view of all posts with status
CRUD operations for posts and users

acceptance_criteria.criteria: The platform must achieve a Lighthouse Performance score of 90+.
acceptance_criteria.description: Ensures Next.js SSR and CDN assets are optimized for Core Web Vitals.
acceptance_criteria.title: Performance Benchmark

acceptance_criteria.criteria: All user inputs must be sanitized to prevent XSS attacks.
acceptance_criteria.description: Critical for the comment system and markdown rendering.
acceptance_criteria.title: Security Sanitization

acceptance_criteria.criteria: The UI must be fully responsive across mobile, tablet, and desktop.
acceptance_criteria.description: Layout adapts using CSS Grid/Flexbox for all viewports.
acceptance_criteria.title: Mobile Responsiveness

acceptance_criteria.criteria: RSS feed must be valid and auto-update with new posts.
acceptance_criteria.description: Standard XML RSS feed accessible at /rss.xml.
acceptance_criteria.title: RSS Feed Validity

assumptions: Users have basic familiarity with Markdown syntax.
PostgreSQL database is hosted on a managed service (e.g., AWS RDS, Supabase).
Authentication is handled via a standard provider or JWT implementation.
Node.js environment is version 18 or higher.

weaknesses: No WYSIWYG editor for non-technical users
Initial setup complexity compared to WordPress
threats: Rise of static site generators (Hugo, Jekyll)

stakeholders.interest: Ease of writing and publishing workflow
Code maintainability and tech stack stability

invest_analysis.comments: Complex logic for nesting and moderation.
Depends on having content to search.
Large scope, could be split further.

gaps.impact: High barrier to entry for non-technical writers.
Potential performance hit with large uploads.
Limited insights compared to Google Analytics.

opportunities.value: Increases user retention and recurring traffic.
Allows visual customization without code changes.
